page.title: 06Government National/District
page.content: The Government of the village is at three levels; National, District and Parish (local). The National policies determined by the ruling party at Westminster (London) and administered from the various departments which are based over the country. The District is organised by the Borough of St. Edmundsbury through the District Council who are responsible for the affairs and services of the communities within the District boundary. The village has an elected member who sits for four years when an election is held. The resident adults (over 18 yrs.) are entitled to vote. The names of the electors are published and displayed in the local Post Office (Village Postmaster Mr. John Copson)
